text: Edward James Cooley (April 15, 1933 - April 15, 2020) was an American R&B; singer-songwriter. He co-wrote the song "Fever" and the 1956 song with "Priscilla". Cooley was born in Atlanta, Georgia. Cooley died on April 15, 2020 in Meridian, Mississippi at the age of 87. Obituary: Eddie Cooley, Meridian Star, April 15, 2020. title: Eddie Cooley
